Class MovingImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.geom.RectangularShape
      • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D
        • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
          • Player.MovingImage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.Shape, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Element, Enemy, Player

    public class MovingImage
extends java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
    This represents an image that can move
    Version:
    5/6
    Author:
    John Shelby
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovingImage

        public MovingImage(int x,
                   int y,
                   int w,
                   int h,
                   int frames,
                   java.lang.String name)
        creates a moving image with starting coordinates (x, y), width w, height h, with "frames" amount of animation switches,
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the image
        y - the y coordinate of the image
        w - the width of the image
        h - the height of the image
        frames - the number of frames the animation has
        name - the name of the image file

      • moveByAmount

        public void moveByAmount(double x,
                         double y)
        moves the movingImage by x units horizontally, and y units vertically
        Parameters:
        x - the horizontal distance to move the movingImage
        y - the vertical distance to move the movingImage
